name: Leo Media Search Bot
description: When you going to send file on telegram channel/group this bot will save that in database, So you can search that easily in inline mode

SESSION.description: Session name for db.if u are already user of old media search bot. please type here that bot's session name. it can be found info.py file as SESSION

UPDATES_CHANNEL.description: ID of a Channel which you want to do Force Sub to use the bot. Example: -100123456789

LOG_CHANNEL.description: Logs Channel ID for some Tracking XD. Example: -100123456789

BROADCAST_AS_COPY.description: Broadcast as Copy or with Forward Tag. Value should be True/False.

SESSION_NAME.description: Any Bot Session Name for Save Users in db.

CHANNELS.description: Username or ID of database channel or group. Separate multiple IDs by space.

ADMINS.description: Username or ID of Admin. Separate multiple Admins by space.

AUTH_USERS.description:
Username or ID of users to give access of inline search. Separate multiple users by space.
Leave it empty if you don't want to restrict bot usage.

BANNED_USERS.description: Banned users user id , these users are banned from the bot permenentally

START_MSG.description: A Massege for view at start. If you want to change it you can change it here

SHARE_BUTTON_TEXT.description: A Massege for add to share button. If you want to change it you can change it here
SHARE_BUTTON_TEXT.value:

USE_CAPTION_FILTER.description: Whether bot should use captions to improve search results. (True False)

DATABASE_URI.description: This is the db which use to save files to work inline search.. get it from mongodb.com

MONGODB_URI.description: mongo based db for save users in db .. Dont use the inline search bots database URI

DATABASE_NAME.description: Name of the database in mongoDB.

COLLECTION_NAME.description: Name of the collections. Defaults to Telegram_files. If you are using the same database, then use different collection name for each bot

MAX_RESULTS.description: Maximum limit for inline search results

CACHE_TIME.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server
